panel.p:
The Supreme Court dealt Argentina a setback in its long-running battle with creditors, heightening the risk of a default by the country.
BANANANANANANA

Siemens and Mitsubishi launched a bid for Alstom's energy business, aiming to thwart GE's $17 billion offer for the French group.
BANANANANANANA

Alibaba released new details of its business ahead of its IPO, including a sales breakdown and names of people who control board nominations.
BANANANANANANA

The IMF predicted U.S. inflation will remain below a 2% target through 2017 and said rates should stay near zero even longer than investors expect.
BANANANANANANA

The British pound topped $1.70 for the first time in nearly five years on bets the Bank of England will raise rates.
BANANANANANANA

EU inflation fell to a 0.6% rate, boosting expectations that more central banks in the bloc will provide stimulus.
BANANANANANANA

The Dow edged up 5.27 points to 16781.01 as investors weighed Iraqi turmoil against economic data and deals.
BANANANANANANA

GM pushed its repair-cost estimate for this year to $2 billion as it disclosed plans to replace ignition keys.
BANANANANANANA

States and cities would have to add retiree-benefit promises to their balance sheets under an accounting proposal.
BANANANANANANA

Internet provider Level 3 agreed to buy rival TW Telecom for about $5.7 billion.
BANANANANANANA

Boeing said U.S. and European regulators approved its larger Dreamliner model.
BANANANANANANA
